column5: Anybody have ANY info on Hyatts Manion Lake Lodge. Planning a grouse and walleye trip in Oct. Thanks for any help
Not much help, did a portage in camping/fishing trip many, many years ago, in the spring, I believe we left the vehicles at that camp. Bill

Haven't been there for 30 years. Was run down by previous owner. Have heard it's very nice now. We had pretty good walleye fishing back then and big northern also. Sorry I can't be of more help. Nice area up there.
This might be same lodge, not sure.http://www.lake-link.com/forums//can...on-lake/99894/

Yes it's Hyatt's. They have a good website. Lodge sits right on the spot where old man Bow and his help stayed. Many years ago it was called Bows Camp. We went there the year after the road went in in the 70's. Got run down after he died. The new folks are supposed to run a nice operation. I would like to visit it again someday.
Just got back from their 7/30/18. stayed on Mount Lake. Well run operation. Fishing was slow because of the poor weather, still had a great time.
